result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Devon J Barber

records.addlTxt: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
8:45 AM Defendant Devon J Barber in court, in custody.  Attorney Oren Jakobson in court for Devon J Barber.  Attorney David R. Knaapen in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Dean Fleisner is sworn as a witness and questioned by Attorney Knaapen. He is a sergeant with the Wisconsin Rapids Police Department. On 8/9/22, he received a complaint of a stolen vehicle, which was a moped. The owner stated that no one was given permission to take the vehicle. The vehicle was located at Four Stools Short. A description was given of the person and he was located in the outdoor area of Four Stools. That person was identified as the defendant. The witness identifies the defendant in the courtroom.  T.A.M. was storing the vehicle and indicated that it was stored in a shed on her property. Attorney Jakobson cross-examines witness.  
Attorney Jakobson makes statement and feels there is no probable cause.
Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed. Not guilty plea to both counts. Bond is continued.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on September 13, 2022 at 08:45 am.

4:14 PM Defendant Devon J Barber in court, in custody.  Attorney Oren Jakobson in court for Devon J Barber.  Attorney David R. Knaapen in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Knaapen states that officer is not available today even though he was subpoened. He asks that matter be reset. If court dismisses case, he will be refiling. Attorney Jakobson states he does not object to rescheduling.
Court finds good cause to rescheduled preliminary hearing. Bond is continued.
No contact with MCB or residence. $2500 22-11953
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on August 29, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

No contact w/victim, MCB,  or their residence 

DEFENDANT REFUSED TO SIGN
1:39 PM Defendant Devon J Barber appeared by video.  Attorney Jennifer ZimaBond continued  in court for State of Wisconsin.
No contact w/victim or their residence
